result.execSummary:
The defendant Long Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Drug Paraphernalia. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Long Vang

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 09:37 AM Hmong Interpreter, totaling Sue Lee appeared by video means.  Interpreter sworn.  Defendant Long Vang appeared by zoom technology by phone means from the Dunn County Jail along with Attorney Steven G. Richards by video means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Mr. Vang previously appeared and was informed of his charges and his rights, does he have any questions?  No questions.  Attorney Richards spoke with Attorney Seifert and have an agreement to amend to county ordinance 9.17 possession of drug paraphernalia.  We recommend $100 forfeiture + costs totaling $330.50.  Mr. Seifert confirms the agreement.  Mr. Vang confirms the agreement.  Subject to completion of plea agreement, Court amends to Pepin County Ordinance possession of drug paraphernalia.  To the amend charge, defendant pleads guilty.  Court accepts his plea and finds him guilty, assess $330.50 including costs.  Request 60 days to set up payment plan after he's done in custody in Dunn Co.  Mr. Vang unsure when he will be released.  Court orders $50/mo. com. 9/1/22.  If you are still in custody on 9/1, contact the Clerk of Court to adjust the start date of your payment plan.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

02:15 PM Defendant Long Vang appeared by zoom technology by phone means from the Dunn County Jail. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Hmong Interpreter, Tou Sue Lee appeared by video means.  Interpreter Sworn.  Interpreter established contact with the defendant.  Court advises defendant of charge of possess of drug paraphernalia/max. penalties.  It is alleged this is as a repeater offender.  Defendant informs he was a passenger in the vehicle and those things did not belong to me.  The State has the obligation to prove him guilty at a later date.  Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights.  Defendant requests an attorney.  He is not working.  He should contact the PD Office in Eau Claire as he likely would qualify for PD.  Court requests the DA's position on bond.  Given the nature of the allegation and defendant interested in requesting counsel, State waive requesting bond unless the Court is requesting bond.  Court imposes a standard Signature Bond of $500.  Defendant confirms his address is currently in the Dunn County Jail.  Court quashes the warrant.  A Hmong Interpreter will be available for him on 5/3.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

01:52 PM  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Hmong Interpreter, Tou Ja-Vue Yang appeared by video means.  Interpreter sworn.  Interpreter attempts to make contact with a defendant Long Vang if on the call. No response. Court requests Interpreter interpret Mr. Long to unmute if on the call.  No response.  Court asks Mr. Interpreter to interpret the following:  A criminal complaint issued against Long Vang alleging possession of drug paraphernalia as a PTC as a repeater.  A summons was issued to Long Vang to appear in court today at 1:30.  Long Vang fails to appear according to summons.  Mr. Seifert requests a warrant.  Court authorizes a warrant for Long Vang's failure to appear pursuant to summons.
